intro: Myrsine emarginata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf myrsine, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are usually elliptical or ovate, with a distinctive emarginate (notched) tip. The flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and often have four or five petals.
